newsitem.title: USA: Dow backs off closing highs, Nasdaq down and mixed.
newsitem.headline: Dow backs off closing highs, Nasdaq down and mixed.

text.p: Wall Street shares trended lower shortly after the market open on Wednesday, lacking impetus after a rally in the technology sector pushed them to record levels on Tuesday.
The Dow industrial average was down around 32 points or 0.44 percent at 7351, with declining issues outnumbering advancing issues by 10 to seven.
The Nasdaq composite index, which pushed above the 1400-point level for the first time on Tuesday, was off around five points at 1404 in mixed trading.
"It's a lackluster market," one trader said. "It has no conviction either way."

Technology stocks again led the list of active stocks, but while some networking stocks and International Business Machine Corp rose, a drop in stocks like Intel Corp and Microsoft Corp pulled the broader index lower. Microsoft was off 3/4 at 125-7/8, Intel was off one at 168-5/16 and IBM was up 1-1/4 at 90-5/8 on a post-split basis.
Intel said it filed a suit against Digital Equipment Corp alleging the company refused to return confidential information. Digital was trading off 5/8 at 36-1/4.
